abstract: Despite a history among European antitrust regulators of toughness when it comes to cartel busting, the new competition commissioner, Joaquín Almunia, has so far shown a somewhat lighter touch, as more and more companies plead for leniency in tough economic times.

lead_paragraph: European antitrust regulators have long prided themselves on their toughness when it comes to cartel-busting, throwing the book — and increasingly heavy fines — at violators.

headline.main: Europe’s Antitrust Chief Shows Leniency on Fines
